block.p: Wilhelmina Wolff Smith, a cellist, and Mark Theodore Mandarano, a conductor, are to be married today at the Harrington Meeting House in Pemaquid, Me. The Rev. Robert Ives, a Congregational minister, is to perform the ceremony.

Ms. Smith, 33, is keeping her name. She is a member of the Mannes Trio and Music From the Copland House and has performed with the Orpheus Chamber Orchestra and the Musicians From Marlboro touring program. She is the artistic director of two chamber music festivals, the Salt Bay Chamberfest, which she founded in Damariscotta, Me., and ClassicFest, in Pensacola, Fla. She graduated from the Curtis Institute of Music in Philadelphia.

Wilhelmina Wolff Smith, a cellist, and Mark Theodore Mandarano, a conductor, are to be married today at the Harrington Meeting House in Pemaquid, Me. The Rev. Robert Ives, a Congregational minister, is to perform the ceremony.

Ms. Smith, 33, is keeping her name. She is a member of the Mannes Trio and Music From the Copland House and has performed with the Orpheus Chamber Orchestra and the Musicians From Marlboro touring program. She is the artistic director of two chamber music festivals, the Salt Bay Chamberfest, which she founded in Damariscotta, Me., and ClassicFest, in Pensacola, Fla. She graduated from the Curtis Institute of Music in Philadelphia.

The bride is a daughter of Priscilla and David E. Smith of Walpole, Mass. Her father is a professor emeritus of American literature and a former dean of the School of Humanities and Arts at Hampshire College in Amherst, Mass. Her mother, also retired, taught music at the Eaglebrook School in Deerfield, Mass.

Mr. Mandarano, 35, is the assistant conductor of the Pacific Symphony Orchestra in Santa Ana, Calif. He graduated from Cornell University and received a master's degree in conducting from the Peabody Conservatory. From 1994 to 1999 he was the resident conductor of the American Symphony Orchestra in New York.

The bridegroom is the son of Patricia and Carmine V. Mandarano of New Rochelle, N.Y. His mother, who is retired, was the director of food services for the New Rochelle Board of Education. His father retired as the chairman of the occupational education department at New Rochelle High School.
The couple met in August 1997 while performing at the Bard Music Festival at Bard College in Annandale-on-Hudson, N.Y.
